alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 07 at 5:01AM MST until January 08 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH expected. * WHERE...Platte County including Wheatland and Bordeaux, South Laramie Range and adjacent foothills including Interstate 80 between Laramie and Cheyenne. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning. A lull in strong winds may occur this afternoon and evening, with high winds likely to return between 2 AM and 5 PM MST on Saturday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs. In addition, patchy blowing and drifting snow could lead to slick road conditions and visibilities under one mile at times.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
